snippet: Exports grew 3.8 percent, pushed higher by strong shipments of cars and other manufactured goods to the United States.
abstract: Preliminary data shows that Japan's economy grew at robust annualized pace of 3.5 percent in first quarter of 2013,first sign that bold monetary and economic policies of Prime Min Shinzo Abe are starting to bear fruit.
lead_paragraph: Exports grew 3.8 percent, pushed higher by strong shipments of cars and other manufactured goods to the United States.

headline.main: Japan’s Economy Growing at 3.5% Annualized Rate
headline.print_headline: Japan’s Economy Growing at 3.5% Annualized Rate
